## **Introduction**

In this part, we just used the pathways have > 40 genes.

## **Summary** 

<figure class="half">
    <img src="https://github.com/xsun1229/factor_analysis/raw/master/output/CEDAR_cell_sum_40genes_pruned.png" width="80%">
</figure>

## **Detailed results for 6 cell types**

We just listed the pairs show sign consistancy (at p-value < 0.05 in resampling) here

We did some literature searching for some disease related pairs (p-value < 0.01 in resampling) in monocyte and B cell.

### monocyte CD14

#### Histogram to show the number of SNPs that each pair contains

<figure class="half">
    <img src="https://github.com/xsun1229/factor_analysis/raw/master/output/snp_count_cd14_cedar_qc_kegg_40genes_pruned.jpeg" width="80%">
</figure>

#### effectsize fitting summary 

```{r echo=FALSE}
load("/project2/xinhe/xsun/website/factor_analysis/output/pwy_name_cd14_cedar_qc_kegg_40genes_pruned.rdata")
DT::datatable(final_full, options = list(pageLength =5))
```


#### Checking the reverse causality

**The suffix "_reverse" are the results for traits -> LV (using all candidate SNPs after LD Clumping), the suffix "_rremove" are the results for traits -> LV (using all candidate SNPs after LD Clumping but remove the SNPs have fdr < 0.2)**

```{r echo=FALSE}
load("/project2/xinhe/xsun/website/factor_analysis/output/mbe_cd14_cedar_qc_kegg_40genes_pruned.rdata")
DT::datatable(sum, options = list(pageLength =5))
```
